place.name: LLANNERCH AERON
place.gazetteerText: LLANERCHAYRON, a parish in Aberayron district, Cardigan; on the river Ayron, 2 miles SE of Aberayron, and 11 NW of Lampeter r. station. Post town, Aber ayron, under Carmarthen. Acres, 1,606. Real property, £988. Pop., 228. Houses, 50. The property is divided among a few. Llanerchayron House belonged to the Parrys, and passed to the Lewises. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £73. Patrons, the Earl of Lisburne and the Lewis family. The church is tolerable. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
